name: Astro King
effect:
On the turn this demon attacks, each [Fire] monster in your portal may attack.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 5 healthy PCs.
Reward: Count your opponent's hand. For each card there fewer than 4, destroy a monster.

name: Aurora Feather
effect:
While this bird is in your score pile, your hand size is +1.
Don't be distracted by her plumage.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 3 PCs.
Reward: No reward.

name: Bee Assault
effect:
Storable - may attack when your monster attacks.
Organized insect tactics overwhelm opponents.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 different elements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Bee Commando
effect:
Storable - may attack when your monster attacks.
They only tackle the tough jobs.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 different elements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Chicken Flock
effect:
Storable - may attack when your bird attacks. When this bird attacks, you may reveal a PC from hand and play it hidden.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a card.
Reward: Play an action from your discard pile.

name: Cleama 2.0
effect:
When Cleama 2.0 wins a fight, you may make a PC strength +2 until end of turn.
The guy that asked me out the other day wasn't that bad, though he's not very good-looking.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may destroy a monster in your portal.

name: Comad Goo
effect:
You will learn to worship this god when it defeats you.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 3 cards.

name: Corbenik
effect:
The strength of each other PC in play is added to the strength of a PC fighting Corbenik.
Phase: 5 - The Rebirth
To Play/To Flip: Log out 3 of your PCs, each healthy and bearing a weapon and armor.
Reward: No reward.

name: Crab Brigade
effect:
They still can't decide if they're crabs or turtles.
To Play/To Flip: Remove 5 [Water] monsters in your discard pile from the game.
Reward: Play 2 hidden cards.

name: Crim 3.0
effect:
When your knight wins a fight, you may make your opponent sacrifice a card.
I'm not the type of guy who feels like he has to keep changing with the times. I'm comfortable with who I am.
To Play/To Flip: Make your opponent destroy one of your monsters.

name: Crimson Knight
effect:
You may have more than one Crimson Knight in play.
There are dozens of PCs that make up the ranks of the Crimson Knights.

name: Cubia Core A
effect:
Storable - may attack when your core attacks. When you play this core, your opponent may sacrifice a PC and discard a PC to destroy it.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Assign a monster in your portal to a new or unresolved fight.

name: Cubia Core B
effect:
Storable - may attack when your core attacks. When you play this core, your opponent may sacrifice an item and discard an item to destroy it.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Take a card from your discard pile into hand.

name: Cubia Core C
effect:
Storable - may attack when your core attacks. When you play this core, your opponent may sacrifice a hidden card and discard an action to destroy it.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Take a card from your deck into hand. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Cubia Core D
effect:
Storable - may attack when your core attacks. When you play this core, your opponent may sacrifice 2 cards to destroy it.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Opponent skips his or her next turn.

name: Cubia Stage 2
effect:
This core cannot be destroyed (except when losing a fight) or returned to its owner's hand.
Morganna designed Cubia to balance the game.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice any number of core whose strengths total 6 or more.
Reward: Play up to 3 PCs.

name: Cubia Stage 3
effect:
This core cannot be destroyed (except when losing a fight) or returned to its owner's hand.
Cubia fought back against hackers.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice any number of core whose strengths total 8 or more.
Reward: Play up to 3 items.

name: Cubia Stage 4
effect:
This core cannot be destroyed (except when losing a fight) or returned to its owner's hand.
Copying his data, Cubia kept pace with Kite.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice any number of core whose strengths total 10 or more.
Reward: Play up to 3 cards.

name: Culhwch
effect:
Take up to 3 items from your discard pile into hand.
This place was once where all of the unsuccessful non-player characters drifted.

name: Cyan 2.0
effect:
Cyan 2.0 is strength +2 while there are no hidden cards in play.
I'll trade 1 Gimme Life for 1 Rouge Fragment.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may remove up to 4 cards in your discard pile from the game.

name: Death Head
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Darkness] monster attacks.
A skull that is not quite dead yet.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Perform the reward of a monster in your opponent's score pile.

name: Defender Mail
effect:
When you play this item, you may reveal the top 3 cards of your deck and take 1 into hand.
The armor of the Knights defends them well.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 knights. Bearer must be a knight.

name: Demon Wyvern
effect:
A malignant spirit from the underworld.
To Play/To Flip: Return 5 of your hidden cards to hand.
Reward: Spot 2 cards of the same element and return them to their owner's hands.

name: Doberman Pack
effect:
Storable.
Howling hounds of Hades.
To Play/To Flip: Return 3 of your [Fire] cards in play to hand to destroy a monster.
Reward: Return a hidden card to its owner's hand.

name: Dorin
effect:
Take a field or grunty from your discard pile into hand.
Players who considered them amusing came up with their own variations of failed characters.

name: Double Sweep
effect:
Make that Long Arm strength +1 (or +4 if bearing no weapon).
You've been running around with a huge monster chasing you?
To Play/To Flip: Your Long Arm must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Earth Sword
effect:
When you play this item, you may play an item.
A weapon attuned with Gaia's strength.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Evil Horn
effect:
When this wizard attacks, you may play a monster to attack.
When you hear the horn, your time is up.
To Play/To Flip: Remove 6 [Wood] cards in your discard pile from the game.
Reward: No reward.

name: Fire Spear
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may draw a card.
Works well against water monsters.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Flame Pack
effect:
Storable.
Six heads are better than three.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire].
Reward: Return your [Fire] card in play to hand to draw 2 cards.

name: Fuse Blades
effect:
A handy weapon that's a good choice for low-level PCs.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Ginkan 2.0
effect:
When you play a knight, you may play an item.
I suspected the rumors were true.
Reward: Opponent may play a card from his or her discard pile or hand, but not hidden.

name: Gladiator Column
effect:
They, who are about to die, salute you.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Take 2 monsters from your discard pile into hand.

name: Hades Hound
effect:
Storable.
Only the lead dog sees new scenery.
To Play/To Flip: You must play this hound to your portal.
Reward: No reward.

name: Harpy Flock
effect:
Storable - may attack when your bird attacks. When this bird attacks, you may play a PC.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 cards.
Reward: Play an item from your discard pile.

name: Harpy Queen
effect:
She rules with an iron claw.
To Play/To Flip: Reveal 2 of your hidden PCs and return them to hand.
Reward: Play a card from your discard pile.

name: Hatchet
effect:
One of the more uncomplicated weapons.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Headhunt Lair
effect:
Storable - may attack when your ghost or undead attacks.
They're interested in you... or at least your head.
To Play/To Flip: You must play this undead to your portal.
Reward: Wound a PC not bearing an item.

name: Heavy Metal Column
effect:
Storable - may attack when your warrior attacks.
Steel axes wielded with cold steel hearts.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Remove 2 cards in opponent's discard pile from the game.

name: House Golem
effect:
Storable - may attack when your golem attacks.
Is it really an animated creature made of dwellings?
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a card.
Reward: No reward.

name: Jealous Cobra
effect:
Storable - may attack when your snake or lizard attacks.
A green-eyed monster.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Earth] [Earth] [Earth].
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a monster in his or her portal.

name: Juka Tempest
effect:
Make that Heavy Axeman strength +3 (or +4 if you have no other PC in play).
Like its wielder, Subaru's axe speaks with authority.
To Play/To Flip: Your Heavy Axeman must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Justice 2.0
effect:
When you play Justice 2.0, each player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards there that aren't monsters.
He fights alongside Peace to maintain order in "The World."
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play any number of storable monsters to his or her portal.

name: Kakasinger
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Earth] monster attacks.
Scarecrows are made to look like people too.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. You may play this card.

name: Kazu 2.0
effect:
You have +1 hand size.
Oh, don't tell Sis about what I said! She is impossible when she gets pissed off~! :)
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play a PC from his or her discard pile or hand.

name: King Worm
effect:
You thought the babies were bad?
To Play/To Flip: Spot 5 different elements.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices an elemental card.

name: Kite 2.0
effect:
When you are about to draw destiny for Kite 2.0, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and replace them in any order.
Why did Aura entrust me with the bracelet?
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may draw 3 cards.

name: Kite's Bracelet
effect:
When bearer is healthy and in a fight before destiny is drawn, you may wound him or her to return all monsters in that fight to their owners' hands.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 5 PCs (or 3 and sacrifice a weapon on bearer). Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Lamia Assassin
effect:
Storable - may attack when your snake or lizard attacks.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: For the rest of the turn, when your opponent sacrifices a card, you may destroy an item.

name: Little Doggie
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Fire] monster attacks.
Pound for pound, one mean pup.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Return up to 3 hidden cards to their owner's hands.

name: Magatumkuro
effect:
While this undead is in your score pile, your opponent needs an additional victory point to win.
Death has no meaning for such a creature.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 4 cards, each of a different element.
Reward: No reward.

name: Miasma Wyvern
effect:
While this insect is in your score pile, you may have an additional hidden card in play.
It's used to noxious environments.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 2 actions.
Reward: No reward.

name: Mistral 2.0
effect:
When your opponent's monsters attack, you may place your card in play on top of your deck.
We can't... just let it be! I want him to play a great game as well. :)
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play up to 2 PCs, each from his or her discard pile or hand.

name: Monkey Crab
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Water] monster attacks.
Watch out! It's got a rock.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play a hidden card from your discard pile.

name: Moonlighter
effect:
Storable - may attack when your insect attacks.
They seek the light of the moon.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 different elements.
Reward: Opponent returns his or her elemental card in play to hand.

name: Mugai Wyvern
effect:
Capable of defeating even the most skilled swordsman.
To Play/To Flip: Return 3 of your hidden cards to hand.
Reward: Spot an elemental card and return it to its owner's hand.

name: Necrotic Eye
effect:
While this demon is in your score pile, each time your monster is played to attack, a monster in your portal may attack.
It stares you down at the cellular level.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 2 events.
Reward: No reward.

name: Nega Guardian
effect:
Now we know how the Nega remains safe.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 4 cards.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices 3 cards.

name: Neptune Medusa
effect:
While this snake is in your score pile, [Earth] monsters are each destiny +1.
Snakes for heads, and the power of the sea.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 3 items.
Reward: No reward.

name: Oborozukiyo 2.0
effect:
When you play Oborozukiyo 2.0, you may wound a healthy PC.
My goal! Conquer 10 areas in one day!!
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may draw a card.

name: Ochimusha Column
effect:
While this warrior is in your score pile, it provides an additional [Thunder].
Runaway warriors, gathered to defeat you.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 4 monsters.
Reward: No reward.

name: Orca 2.0
effect:
When your opponent's monsters attack, you may wound your healthy PC to allow up to 2 monsters to be assigned to him or her this turn.
Orca of the Azure Sea teamed with Balmung, the other Descendant of Fianna.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play up to 3 hidden cards from his or her discard pile.

name: Pazuzu
effect:
On the turn this undead attacks, you determine the order fights are resolved.
King of the evil wind demons, bearer of storms.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 undead.
Reward: Destroy each PC not bearing an item.

name: Peace 2.0
effect:
When you play Peace 2.0, each player reveals his or her hand and discards all monsters there.
A friend to Justice, they work together to make "The World" a safer place.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play any number of items.

name: PhaRai Kruz
effect:
Make that Wavemaster strength +2 (or +4 if bearing no armor).
You can count on it!
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Phoenix's Fire
effect:
When you play this item, you may destroy all hidden cards.
Strong, rare blade with enhanced critical hit capability.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Fire][Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] (or [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] [Fire] and sacrifice a weapon on bearer). Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Pippy
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Wood] monster attacks.
She has cute little birdies.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play an item from your discard pile.

name: Rachel 2.0
effect:
When you flip an action, you may play a hidden card.
I'll make it cheap. You can pay me back later.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play a card.

name: Rainbow Tail
effect:
As deadly as it is beautiful.
To Play/To Flip: Reveal 4 of your hidden PCs and return them to hand.
Reward: Play 2 cards from your discard pile.

name: Razine
effect:
Storable - may attack when your [Thunder] monster attacks.
He's got no armor, but he's well-armed.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Play a card.

name: Ruem Spiral
effect:
Make that Blademaster strength +2 (or +4 if fighting multiple monsters).
Hey, what are you doing? I'm telling you to get out! Leave here at once!
To Play/To Flip: Your Blademaster must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Salu 2.0
effect:
Salu 2.0 is strength +1 for each other healthy knight you have.
He is second-in-command, serving as lieutenant to Ginkan.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may play up to 2 cards from his or her discard pile as hidden cards.

name: Sconk
effect:
Take up to 3 actions from your discard pile into hand.
The boundary between player and non-player character is quite indistinct.

name: Scorpion Brigade
effect:
Storable - may attack when your crustacean attacks.
That's just more spiky holes when they roll all over you.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Water] monster.
Reward: Play a hidden card.

name: Seeker
effect:
Storable - may attack when your monster with no element attacks, and must fight the same PC.
Seekers defend the Phase of Rebirth.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: No reward.

name: Sieg 2.0
effect:
When you draw destiny for Sieg 2.0, you may play that destiny card, but not hidden.
Balmung got strong while I was asleep, but I'm sure I'll catch up!
Reward: Opponent may discard any number of cards.

name: SK's Sword
effect:
When you play this item, you may play a knight as your fourth PC.
Zealous law enforcer Silver Knight often wields his sword for justice.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 of your healthy knights. Bearer must be a knight.

name: Skull Devilgon
effect:
An evil power fills its carcass with hate.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Remove up to 2 PCs from your discard pile and play them.

name: Skull Hero
effect:
Storable - may attack when your ghost or undead attacks.
It could only be a hero to other undead.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness].
Reward: Play a PC from your discard pile.

name: Sled Dog King
effect:
On the turn this hound attacks, each hound in your portal may attack.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 hounds.
Reward: Return 4 of your [Fire] cards in play to hand to play a monster to your portal (ignoring "To Play" requirements). It need not be storable.

name: Snip Snap Brigade
effect:
Storable - may attack when your crustacean attacks.
More snips means more snaps.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Exchange any number of your cards in hand with your hidden cards.

name: Spear Core MK3
effect:
When you play this item, you may heal all of your PCs.
An awesome rare weapon with the power of skill drain.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 14 monsters (or 12 and sacrifice a weapon on bearer). Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Spin Figure
effect:
When you finally deduce which way it's turning, it'll be too late.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 5 cards.
Reward: Destroy 2 cards of the same element.

name: Spiritas
effect:
Take up to 2 events, each of a different element, from your discard pile into hand.
There are even those who have lost their bodies on the outside.

name: Subaru 1.0
effect:
When you replace Subaru 1.0, you may play an item from your hand or discard pile.
Every story, I feel, can have several possible endings.

name: Subaru 3.0
effect:
You may skip your normal card play to heal a knight.
There is a path in the direction you desire... I'm sure.
To Play/To Flip: Skip your next 2 turns (OR 1 turn if replacing any Subaru).

name: Subaru's Axe
effect:
Seldom used by Lady Subaru, but fearsome nonetheless.
Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 8 items (or 6 and sacrifice a weapon on bearer).

name: Swordmanoid Column
effect:
Storable - may attack when your warrior attacks.
Like a machine of whirring deadly blades.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Remove a card in opponent's discard pile from the game.

name: Tartarga
effect:
Take a monster from your discard pile into hand.
The Epitaph of Twilight. To sum it up in a nut shell, it is a tale.

name: Terror Cyclone
effect:
Make that Twin Blade strength +2 (or +4 if wounded).
Still playing by the rules and singing that tired old song?
To Play/To Flip: Your Twin Blade must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Thea
effect:
Take up to 2 PCs from your discard pile into hand.
Yes, it'll be a very tricky business.

name: Tsukasa 2.0
effect:
Tsukasa 2.0 cannot log out. Your opponent's storable monsters must be played to his or her portal unless at least 3 monsters are already there.
Are you able to, you know, exit "The World"?
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may take up to 2 cards from his or her discard pile into hand.

name: Tsukasa's Wand
effect:
When you play this item, you may destroy an elemental card.
The actual power of Tsukasa's weapon was never tested.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 different elements (or 5 and sacrifice a weapon on bearer). Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Undead Voodoo
effect:
Mystical forces make it powerful and angry.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness][Darkness][Darkness][Darkness].
Reward: Wound a PC.

name: Unicorn Blade
effect:
When you play this item, you may discard a card.
Solid low-level weapon with magical abilities.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Vak Maxima
effect:
Make that Heavy Blade strength +2 (or +4 if you have no hidden cards).
She has a fiery temper but she's a strong ally in a fight.
To Play/To Flip: Your Heavy Blade must be in a fight. Flip this action before drawing destiny.

name: Vlitramaster
effect:
Master of the deadly flames.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth].
Reward: Opponent sacrifices all but 2 monsters in his or her portal.

name: Water Wand
effect:
When you play this item, beginning with you, each player may play a hidden card.
Simple weapon with water-based attacks.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Wiggly
effect:
Storable - may attack when your monster with no element attacks.
A small, but dangerous larva.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: If you have 6 victory points in your score pile, you win.

name: Wiseman 2.0
effect:
Your PCs each have an additional tolerance.
Wiseman began to refer to the Eight Phases as the Cursed Wave.
To Play/To Flip: Opponent may take a card from his or her discard pile into hand.
